instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no liquid no signs of damage.

ppbus - 8.6v
pp3v42 - 3.42v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  - 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
No pulse at 5V coil when you connect the charger?

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
No pulse at 5V coil when you connect the charger?  - i get a pulse when first pluging in 5v.  after .01v

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.  - yes drop is in voltage

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message: Then check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>3_L</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message: they both are pulsing when first plugged in. i think they are going to 3.3v

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
Triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> various times, is easy to catch the pulse, if exists.
In such case, all S3 and S0 voltages must pulse too.
Check for pulse at all big coils, including VCORE.
Also check at pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode too.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message: I tired starting in smc bypass and i got fanspin.  but then almost right after something started smoking.  i can't find what burned on the board.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
Some SMC sensor stops it to start in normal mode.
Now check what got burnt.
Check all secondary power supplies, and pages 57/58.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> had a hole in it and was expanded. i replaced it.
page 57 is - Misc Power Supplies
page 58 is - Power FETs

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7090</CAPACITOR>/98.
<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> can be bad too.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
diode mode <CAPACITOR>C7090</CAPACITOR> - .387
<CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR> - .322
<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> tested against known good and reading are same.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
do i have the right pages that you wanted me to test
page 57 is - Misc Power Supplies
page 58 is - Power FETs

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
l7320 - 1.8 pulse
l7310- 1.8 pulse
l7630 - 1v pulse
l7430 - 1.2v pulse
l7560 - 3.3v stable
l7130 - 8.6v stable
l3095 - 0v no pulse
l7701 - 0v no pulse

i'm getting a pulse fan spin on smc bypass now

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
Do you get a pulse only, or cycling?
Check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
if i do smc bypass i get pulse of fanspin

i get pulse on  <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>   a little over 1v

threads.title: 00165 no fan spin
threads.message:
Did you check for short after Power MOSFETs?
Output voltages pulsing there too?

Try known good BIOS, just in case.
